I have raised dozens of pigeons in my own house. I also like pigeons very much. I think the pigeon should be taken out in a cage after it is identified as its home. After it is released, it will fly in the direction of home. The biggest feature that distinguishes it from parrots is that each pigeon has different attributes, and their probability of returning home is also different.

I'd love carrier pigeons!
instead of bird houses I'd say something like a nest, so people can build a pigeon loft. I think tamed pigeons shouldn't follow you but stay close to the nest if it's nearby. They should carry a bundle, messages and items can be put inside. they drop the bundle in the nest (looks similar to food on campfires), to the next nearest nest if it's full, or keep flying until it's emptied. the collar is a colorful foot ring. they come in multiple colors like horses :-)
I think the small cage should also work on bats, bunnies, chickens, and other small mobs I'm forgetting. "paper and quill" item should be added which is like a two-pages book (front and back), and maybe the ink sack would work differently for those? I'm getting carried away
I kinda like this too but would have to balance it so that having a dolphin near you doesn't always completely prevent drowning. Just helps prevent it now and then

I don't know how to directly reply, so just gonna add another comment: I think even without balancing you still wouldn't 100% survive. First, dolphin should be fast enough to go to the surface, which can be a problem in deep oceans. Second, players mostly get stuck inside structures, where dolphins wouldn't have much room to move around and save you. Third, there may not be dolphins anywhere around.

The dolphins like watching you drown. it's like people burning ants, or orcas torturing seals to death, only the dolphins don't have to do anything. Dolphins are not what you think they are. They are not innocent. Whales would do this, but the comments point out why it would be impractical, even if whales were added to the game. 

I love the idea, though, so maybe dolphins would push drowning players out of the water if they are holding a fish.

It would be so cool to ride them. You could build like a basket saddle that you could stand in and shoot from along with others as one person steers the Mammoth. Mabey you could even build iron spikes that you could place on the tusks to make them do more damage!

Here's what I think a shark would be like.

-Gray,Black or Dark blue

-Baby shark=Small fins

-Adult shark=Medium fins

-You can breed them with salmon

-They deal 5 damage at most

-If you feed them fish a few times you can tame them

I like this idea.
However, this mob needs to be neutral and it doesn't do anything unless it's inspired by the player.

This or any system that promotes breeding for better stats past the average would be lovely. Would make things like selling horses on servers a new occupation and breeding horses worthwhile.

Another good change on this might be making horse stats more visible, which is the part that makes Llama breeding less frustrating despite being similarly random with tendency to an average.

I suspect I know what they were going for, but I also strongly suspect the person who did this didn't understand the math they were creating.

In real life, domestication and breeding for desired traits beats hunting the wild for desired samples all day. In the implementation they create an asymptotic limit to how good a horse you can breed that means the better the more likely a much worse offspring. So you are better off just finding random horses than you are trying to breed good ones.

Even worse, the Minecraft implementation isn't fun. It's tedious and frustrating. This isn't good gaming math.

I don't think it needs to be as complicated as proposed. Simply having a chance for each stat to always improve or degrade would do it. I think what the intention was, was to have children generally inherit from the parent with a chance to get better or worse but they mangled it.

Say you have a stat that is a float between 0.0-1.0 where 1.0 is the best stat and zero is the worst.
p1 is this stat for parent 1. p2 is the stat for parent 2. p3 would be the child stat. R is a pseudorandom value between 0.0 and 1.0.

p3 = min( max( absolute( p1-p2)/2 + 1.1*(R-0.5)*(p1-p2), 0.0), 0.0, 1.0);

What you end up with (if I haven't mangled it) is an even probability centered on creating offspring that is the average of it's parents. i.e. R will have an average value of .5 which will turn the second part of the equation to zero on average. But there is also a chance for a plus or minus 10%.
yes, i'd love adding pangolin, meerkats, bears, and other endangered species

of course!
Komodo dragon blue whales and cape mountain zebras

How about Cave Salamanders? They could or be found in lush caves along with the Axolotl and could work similarly to turtles. When they grow they would drop a Salamander Scale which could be used as a brewing ingredient for a potion that prevents freezing damage (as Salamanders are associated with fire). So the Cave Salamander would be useful as well as a cool addition of an endangered species.

An endangered species I would like to see added to Minecraft would be a red panda. They are super cute  and there aren't very many of them left in the wild. They could eat bamboo and would live in bamboo forests and jungles just like regular pandas.
Thanks for all the support! I would LOVE to see komodo dragons out there, especially since they're practically mythical creatures!

Yes, I love this idea! The pangolin is one of my favorites. They add so many endangered species, that’s why I’m always surprised they won’t add endangered shark species. Not even whale sharks. Also, love everyone’s ideas in the comments too!
I would have much liked this better than a retextured squid
411465878131 Yes, me as well, though I think they could definitely add both.
They said no sharks at the top of the list (no sharks, MINECON Vote rejected monsters)
Sharks were rejected as hostile mobs...

While sharks were rejected, I think a mob should be added that is similar to/inspired by sharks.
1. cannot be "just" a shark... Sharks are stealth predators, so why not have it turn invisible!
2. I picture it would be neutral, but with a sneak attack behavior not unlike a goat's ramming behavior... a one time "attack" that does not make it a "hostile" mob. It does not turn invisible when sneak attacking, it first circles the target, like sharks are famous for...
3. It should glow because the glow because that would give it away, even while invisible, or in the dark... I think it should be like this so that it isn't just a worse, underwater phantom...
4. It turns invisible when it is attacked, then circles the attacker & charges (turning visible) (vaguely similar attack pattern to a phantom, except it is larger[& therefore easier to hit] and more accessible [if you can keep an eye on it, you can still just charge it, whereas a phantom flies away...])
